import io
import contextlib

# Capture output to verify table structure
from rich.console import Console
import sys
from io import StringIO

# Redirect stdout to capture the table output
old_stdout = sys.stdout
sys.stdout = mystdout = StringIO\(\)

# Run main with input to select ''View Tasks''
import builtins
original_input = builtins.input

def mock_input\(prompt\):
    return ''2''  # Select View Tasks

builtins.input = mock_input

try:
    from src.main import main
    main\(\)
except SystemExit:
    pass
except:
    pass  # Ignore any errors from the interactive parts

# Restore original input and stdout
builtins.input = original_input
sys.stdout = old_stdout

output = mystdout.getvalue\(\)
print\(''Captured output:''\)
print\(output\)
")

Bash(python -c "
import sys
import os
from pathlib import Path

# Add the phase-1 directory to the path so imports work correctly
phase1_path = str\(Path\(''.''\).resolve\(\)\)
sys.path.insert\(0, phase1_path\)

from src.manager import TodoManager
from src.models import Priority, Status

print\(''Testing Update and Delete functionality...''\)

# Create a manager instance
manager = TodoManager\(\)

# Add a test task
task = manager.add_task\(''Test Task'', ''Original description'', Priority.MEDIUM\)
print\(f''Added task: ID={task.id}, Title={task.title}, Description={task.description}, Priority={task.priority.value}''\)

# Test update functionality
print\(''Testing Update functionality...''\)
try:
    updated_task = manager.update_task\(
        task_id=task.id,
        title=''Updated Test Task'',
        description=''Updated description'',
        priority=Priority.HIGH
    \)
    print\(f''Updated task: ID={updated_task.id}, Title={updated_task.title}, Description={updated_task.description}, Priority={updated_task.priority.value}''\)
    print\(''Update functionality works correctly''\)
except Exception as e:
    print\(f''Update functionality failed: {e}''\)

# Test delete functionality
print\(''Testing Delete functionality...''\)
try:
    success = manager.delete_task\(task.id\)
    if success:
        print\(f''Task {task.id} deleted successfully''\)
        print\(''Delete functionality works correctly''\)
    else:
        print\(''Delete functionality returned False''\)
except Exception as e:
    print\(f''Delete functionality failed: {e}''\)

# Verify the task is gone
remaining_tasks = manager.get_all_tasks\(\)
if len\(remaining_tasks\) == 0:
    print\(''Task successfully removed from the list''\)
else:
    print\(f''Task still exists in the list. Remaining tasks: {len\(remaining_tasks\)}''\)

print\(''All update and delete functionality tests completed!''\)
")

Bash(python -c "
import sys
import os
from pathlib import Path

# Add the phase-1 directory to the path so imports work correctly
phase1_path = str\(Path\(''.''\).resolve\(\)\)
sys.path.insert\(0, phase1_path\)

from src.manager import TodoManager
from src.models import Priority, Status

print\(''Testing Mark Task Status functionality...''\)

# Create a manager instance
manager = TodoManager\(\)

# Add a test task
task = manager.add_task\(''Test Task'', ''Test description'', Priority.MEDIUM\)
print\(f''Added task: ID={task.id}, Title={task.title}, Status={task.status.value}''\)

# Test updating status from TODO to IN_PROGRESS
print\(''\\nTesting status update from TODO to IN_PROGRESS...''\)
try:
    updated_task = manager.update_task_status\(task.id, Status.IN_PROGRESS\)
    print\(f''Updated task status: ID={updated_task.id}, Status={updated_task.status.value}''\)
    print\(''Status update functionality works correctly''\)
except Exception as e:
    print\(f''Status update functionality failed: {e}''\)

# Test updating status from IN_PROGRESS to DONE
print\(''\\nTesting status update from IN_PROGRESS to DONE...''\)
try:
    updated_task = manager.update_task_status\(task.id, Status.DONE\)
    print\(f''Updated task status: ID={updated_task.id}, Status={updated_task.status.value}''\)
    print\(''Status update functionality works correctly''\)
except Exception as e:
    print\(f''Status update functionality failed: {e}''\)

# Test error case - invalid task ID
print\(''\\nTesting error case - invalid task ID...''\)
try:
    manager.update_task_status\(999, Status.DONE\)
    print\(''Should have raised an error for invalid task ID''\)
except ValueError as e:
    print\(f''Correctly raised error for invalid task ID: {e}''\)

print\(''\\nAll Mark Task Status functionality tests completed!''\)
")

Bash(python -c "
import sys
import os
from pathlib import Path

# Add the phase-1 directory to the path so imports work correctly
phase1_path = str\(Path\(''.''\).resolve\(\)\)
sys.path.insert\(0, phase1_path\)

from src.manager import TodoManager
from src.models import Priority, Status

print\(''Final verification of all functionality...''\)

# Create a manager instance
manager = TodoManager\(\)

# Test 1: Add a task
task = manager.add_task\(''Final Test Task'', ''Final test description'', Priority.MEDIUM\)
print\(f''✓ Added task: ID={task.id}, Title={task.title}, Description={task.description}, Priority={task.priority.value}''\)

# Test 2: Get all tasks
tasks = manager.get_all_tasks\(\)
print\(f''✓ Retrieved {len\(tasks\)} tasks''\)

# Test 3: Update task
updated_task = manager.update_task\(task.id, title=''Updated Final Test Task'', priority=Priority.HIGH\)
print\(f''✓ Updated task: ID={updated_task.id}, Title={updated_task.title}, Priority={updated_task.priority.value}''\)

# Test 4: Update task status
status_task = manager.update_task_status\(task.id, Status.DONE\)
print\(f''✓ Updated status: ID={status_task.id}, Status={status_task.status.value}''\)

# Test 5: Delete task
success = manager.delete_task\(task.id\)
print\(f''✓ Delete operation successful: {success}''\)

# Verify task is deleted
remaining_tasks = manager.get_all_tasks\(\)
print\(f''✓ Remaining tasks after deletion: {len\(remaining_tasks\)}''\)

print\(''\\n✓ All functionality verified successfully!''\)
")

Bash(python -c "
import sys
import os
from pathlib import Path

# Add the phase-1 directory to the path so imports work correctly
phase1_path = str\(Path\(''.''\).resolve\(\)\)
sys.path.insert\(0, phase1_path\)

from src.manager import TodoManager
from src.models import Priority, Status

print\(''Final verification of all functionality...''\)

# Create a manager instance
manager = TodoManager\(\)

# Test 1: Add a task
task = manager.add_task\(''Final Test Task'', ''Final test description'', Priority.MEDIUM\)
print\(f''Added task: ID={task.id}, Title={task.title}, Description={task.description}, Priority={task.priority.value}''\)

# Test 2: Get all tasks
tasks = manager.get_all_tasks\(\)
print\(f''Retrieved {len\(tasks\)} tasks''\)

# Test 3: Update task
updated_task = manager.update_task\(task.id, title=''Updated Final Test Task'', priority=Priority.HIGH\)
print\(f''Updated task: ID={updated_task.id}, Title={updated_task.title}, Priority={updated_task.priority.value}''\)

# Test 4: Update task status
status_task = manager.update_task_status\(task.id, Status.DONE\)
print\(f''Updated status: ID={status_task.id}, Status={status_task.status.value}''\)

# Test 5: Delete task
success = manager.delete_task\(task.id\)
print\(f''Delete operation successful: {success}''\)

# Verify task is deleted
remaining_tasks = manager.get_all_tasks\(\)
print\(f''Remaining tasks after deletion: {len\(remaining_tasks\)}''\)

print\(''All functionality verified successfully!''\)
")

import os

# Test connection

    DATABASE_URL = ''postgresql+asyncpg://neondb_owner:npg_vHtRu97fOiFD@ep-shy-hat-adyyx65h-pooler.c-2.us-east-1.aws.neon.tech/neondb''

from schemas import TaskCreate, TaskUpdate, TaskRead
from models import TaskStatus, TaskPriority

# Test TaskCreate schema
task_create = TaskCreate\(title=''Test Task'', description=''Test Description'', priority=TaskPriority.HIGH, status=TaskStatus.TODO\)
print\(''TaskCreate schema works:'', task_create\)

# Test TaskUpdate schema
task_update = TaskUpdate\(title=''Updated Task'', description=''Updated Description''\)
print\(''TaskUpdate schema works:'', task_update\)

# Test that TaskRead inherits from Task
print\(''TaskRead inherits from Task:'', issubclass\(TaskRead, TaskRead\)\)
print\(''TaskRead has expected fields:'', hasattr\(TaskRead, ''title''\), hasattr\(TaskRead, ''id''\)\)
")

Bash(timeout 5s uv run python -c "
# Test the application without connecting to the database
try:
    import sys
    import os
    sys.path.insert\(0, os.path.abspath\(''.''\)\)
    
    # Import the modules without triggering database connection
    from models import Task
    from schemas import TaskCreate
    from auth import get_current_user
    print\(''✓ All modules imported successfully''\)
    
    # Test main app creation
    from main import app
    print\(''✓ FastAPI app created successfully''\)
    
    # Check that the routes are included
    print\(f''✓ Number of routes: {len\(app.routes\)}''\)
    print\(''✓ All imports successful!''\)
    
except Exception as e:
    print\(f''✗ Error: {e}''\)
    import traceback
    traceback.print_exc\(\)
")
